intro: Peucedanum tenuisectum subsp. microcarpum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and features finely divided, feathery leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. The fruit is a small, dry schizocarp, which splits into two mericarps upon maturity.
